title: Fire statistics data tables

details.body:
This information covers fires, false and other incidents attended by firecrews, and the statistics include the numbers of incidents, fires, fatalities and casualties as well as information on response times to fires. The Home Office also collect information on the workforce, fire prevention work, health and safety and firefighter pensions. All data tables on fire statistics are below.

The Home Office has responsibility for fire services in England. The vast majority of data tables produced by the Home Office are for England but some (0101, 0103, 0201, 0501, 1401) tables are for Great Britain split by nation. In the past the Department for Communities and Local Government (who previously had responsibility for fire services in England) produced data tables for Great Britain and at times the UK. Similar information for devolved administrations are available at Scotland: Fire and Rescue Statistics, Wales: Community safety and Northern Ireland: Fire and Rescue Statistics.

If you use assistive technology (eg a screen reader) and need a version of any of these documents in a more accessible format, please email alternativeformats@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk. Please tell us what format you need. It will help us if you say what assistive technology you use.

Incidents attended

FIRE0101: Incidents attended by fire and rescue services by nation and population (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 31KB)

FIRE0102: Incidents attended by fire and rescue services (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 1.12MB)

FIRE0103: Fires attended by fire and rescue services by nation and population (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 52KB)

FIRE0104: Fire false alarms by reason for false alarm, England (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 62.5KB)

Dwelling fires

FIRE0201: Dwelling fires attended by fire and rescue services by motive population and nation (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 63.8KB)

FIRE0202: Primary fires fatalities and non-fatal casualties in dwellings (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 150KB)

FIRE0203: Dwelling fires by spread of fire and motive (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 37.5KB)

FIRE0204: Average area of damage in dwelling fires (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 12KB)

Non-dwelling fires attended

FIRE0301: Primary fires fatalities and non-fatal casualties in other buildings (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 126KB)

FIRE0302: Primary fires fatalities and non-fatal casualties in road vehicles (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 43.5KB)

FIRE0303: Fire fatalities and non-fatal casualties in outdoor locations by motive and location (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 123KB)

FIRE0304: Other buildings fire by spread of fire and motive (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 35.5KB)

FIRE0305: Average area of damage in fires in other buildings fires (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 12.3KB)

Deliberate fires

FIRE0401: Deliberate fires attended by fire and rescue services (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 623KB)

FIRE0402: Fatalities and non-fatal casualties in deliberate fires attended (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 281KB)

Fatalities and casualties

FIRE0501: Fatalities and non-fatal casualties by nation and population (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 73.5KB)

FIRE0502: Fatalities and non-fatal casualties by fire and rescue authority and location group (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 557KB)

FIRE0503: Fatalities and non-fatal casualties by age gender and type of location (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 566KB)

FIRE0504: Fatalities from fires by cause of death (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 25KB)

FIRE0505: Fatalities and non-fatal casualties in accidental dwelling fires (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 141KB)

FIRE0506: Fatalities and non-fatal casualties from accidental dwelling fires by age and cause (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 270KB)

FIRE0507: Non-fatal firefighter casualties from fires by nature of injury (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 36KB)

FIRE0508: Injuries sustained by firefighters and firefighter fatalities, by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 377KB)

FIRE0509: Firefighter fatalities while on duty, England (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 23KB)

Cause of fire

FIRE0601: Primary fires in dwellings and other buildings by cause of fire (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 34.5KB)

FIRE0602: Primary fires fatalities and non-fatal casualties by source of ignition (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 512KB)

FIRE0603: Primary fires fatalities and non-fatal casualties by item first ignited (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 75KB)

FIRE0604: Primary fire fatalities and casualties by material responsible for development of fire (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 129KB)

FIRE0605: Cause of fire and source of ignition of accidental primary fires by area of damage (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 5.05MB)

Smoke alarms

FIRE0701: Percentage of households owning a smoke alarm or working smoke alarm by nation (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 18KB)

FIRE0702: Primary fires fatalities and non-fatal casualties by presence of smoke alarm (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 8.66MB)

FIRE0703: Smoke alarm failures in dwelling fires by type of alarm (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 27.7KB)

FIRE0704: Percentage of smoke alarms that did not operate and fires resulting in casualties (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 46.4KB)

FIRE0705: Percentage of smoke alarms that operate but did not raise alarm (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 29.5KB)

FIRE0706: Primary fires and casualties in other buildings by presence and operation of smoke alarms (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 4.32MB)

FIRE0707: Percentage of smoke alarms that did not operate by type of alarm (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 36KB)

FIRE0708: Percentage of smoke alarms that operated but did not raise alarm by reason for outcome (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 28KB)

Temporal and seasonal

FIRE0801: Percentage of fires and fire-related fatalities by hour of the day (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 68KB)

FIRE0802: Daily rate of fire incidents by month and location (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 14.8MB)

Special service incidents

FIRE0901: Special Service incidents attended by type of incident and fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 798KB)

FIRE0902: Special Service incidents attended by detailed type of action (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 110KB)

Response Times

FIRE1001: Average response times by location (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 21.2KB)

FIRE1002: Average response times for dwelling fires with or without casualties and or rescues (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 17.5KB)

FIRE1003: Average response times to primary fires, by rural and urban categories (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 19KB)

FIRE1004: Number of incidents by 5 minute response bands (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 63.6KB)

FIRE1005: Average response times for primary fires by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 44.5KB)

FIRE1006: Average response times for dwelling fires by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 43.9KB)

FIRE1007: Average response times for other building fires by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 43.2KB)

FIRE1008: Average response times for road vehicle fires by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 45.8KB)

FIRE1009: Average response times for other outdoor fires by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 43.3KB)

Workforce and workforce diversity

FIRE1101: Staff in post employed by fire and rescue authorities by headcount and full time equivalent by role and fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 262KB)

FIRE1102: Total staff numbers (full time equivalent) by role and fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 253KB)

FIRE1103: Staff headcount by gender, fire and rescue authority and role (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 264KB)

FIRE1104: Staff headcount by ethnicity, fire and rescue authority and role (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 266KB)

FIRE1105: Staff headcount by age, fire and rescue authority and role (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 287KB)

FIRE1106: Staff headcount by religion and role, for England (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 21.6KB)

FIRE1107: Staff headcount by sexual orientation and role, for England (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 22.3KB)

FIRE1110: Staff leaving fire authorities, by fire and rescue authority and by role (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 115KB)

FIRE1111: Staff leaving fire authorities, by reason and by role, England (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 82.4KB)

FIRE1112: Staff retiring from fire and rescue authorities, by reason and fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 155KB)

Fire prevention

FIRE1201: Home fire risk checks carried out by fire and rescue authorities and partners, by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 129KB)

FIRE1202: Fire Safety Audits carried out by fire and rescue authorities, by fire authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 143KB)

FIRE1203: Fire and rescue authority campaigns and initiatives, by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 133KB)

Fire pensions

FIRE1301: Firefighters' pension scheme expenditure (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 12.1KB)

FIRE1302: Firefighters' pension scheme income (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 12.2KB)

FIRE1303: Firefighters' pension surplus and deficit (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 11.5KB)

FIRE1304: Firefighters' pension membership and pension transfers by membership type (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 12.7KB)

Other

FIRE1401: Resident population estimates by nation and fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 55.6KB)

FIRE1402: Accidents occurring to fire and rescue authority vehicles, by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 99.7KB)

FIRE1403: Fire stations and appliances, by fire and rescue authority (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 915KB)

Incident level datasets

Project overview (PDF, 454KB, 9 pages)

Dwelling fires dataset guidance (PDF, 368KB, 13 pages)

Dwelling fires dataset (ODS, 20.5MB)

Domestic appliance fires dataset guidance (PDF, 344KB, 11 pages)

Domestic appliance fires dataset (ODS, 3.78MB)

 .

Added 'FIRE1001: Average response times by location', 'FIRE1002: Average response times for dwelling fires with or without casualties and or rescues',  'FIRE1003: Average response times to primary fires, by rural and urban categories', 'FIRE1004: Number of incidents by 5 minute response bands', 'FIRE1005: Average response times for primary fires by fire and rescue authority', 'FIRE1006: Average response times for dwelling fires by fire and rescue authority', 'FIRE1007: Average response times for other building fires by fire and rescue authority', 'FIRE1008: Average response times for road vehicle fires by fire and rescue authority', 'FIRE1009: Average response times for other outdoor fires by fire and rescue authority' and 'FIRE1403: Fire stations and appliances, by fire and rescue authority'. Updated 'FIRE0204: Average area of damage in dwelling fires' and 'FIRE0305: Average area of damage in fires in other buildings fires'.

Added ‘FIRE0508: Injuries sustained by firefighters and firefighter fatalities, by fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE0509: Firefighter fatalities while on duty, England’, ‘FIRE1101: Staff in post employed by fire and rescue authorities by headcount and full time equivalent by role and fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE1102: Total staff numbers (full time equivalent) by role and fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE1103: Staff headcount by gender, fire and rescue authority and role’, ‘FIRE1104: Staff headcount by ethnicity, fire and rescue authority and role’, ‘FIRE1105: Staff headcount by age, fire and rescue authority and role’, ‘FIRE1106: Staff headcount by religion and role, for England’, ‘FIRE1107: Staff headcount by sexual orientation and role, for England’, ‘FIRE1110: Staff leaving fire authorities, by fire and rescue authority and by role’, ‘FIRE1111: Staff leaving fire authorities, by reason and by role, England’, ‘FIRE1112: Staff retiring from fire and rescue authorities, by reason and fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE1201: Home fire risk checks carried out by fire and rescue authorities and partners, by fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE1202: Fire Safety Audits carried out by fire and rescue authorities, by fire authority’, ‘FIRE1203: Fire and rescue authority campaigns and initiatives, by fire and rescue authority’, and ‘FIRE1402: Accidents occurring to fire and rescue authority vehicles, by fire and rescue authority’.

Added tables 'FIRE STATISTICS TABLE 1301: Firefighters' pension scheme expenditure in England', 'FIRE STATISTICS TABLE 1302: Firefighters' pension scheme income in England', 'FIRE STATISTICS TABLE 1303: Firefighters' pension surplus and deficit in England' and 'FIRE STATISTICS TABLE 1304: Firefighters' pension membership and pension transfers by membership type in England1, 2015 to 2016'.

The data tables associated with the Fire statistics monitor: April 2015 to March 2016 publication (tables 0101, 0102, 0103, 0104, 0201, 2020, 0301, 0302, 0303, 0401, 0402, 0501, 0502, 0901, 0902, 1401) were re-published in Excel format to improve accessibility for some users who were experiencing difficulties with the Open Document Spreadsheet format (.ods). This re-publication also corrects a small number of inconsistencies in the original tables relating to Fire and Rescue Authority (FRA) and quarterly breakdowns of the headline annual England total and the population data used for calculating FRA-level and national rates per million population. Headline data in the accompanying publications are all unchanged.

Updated to accompany publication of ‘Fire statistics monitor: April 2015 to March 2016’, ‘FIRE0101: Incidents attended by fire and rescue services by nation’, ‘FIRE0102: Incidents attended by fire and rescue services in England, by incident type and fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE0103: Fires attended by fire and rescue services by nation’, ‘FIRE0104: False alarms attended by fire and rescue services in England by false alarm type’, ‘FIRE0201: Dwelling fires attended by fire and rescue services by nation’, ‘FIRE0202: Fires, fatalities and casualties in dwelling fires by motive and fire and rescue authority ‘, ‘FIRE0301: Fires, fatalities and casualties in other buildings by motive and building type’, ‘FIRE0302: Fires, fatalities and casualties in road vehicles by motive and vehicle type’, ‘FIRE0303: Fires, fatalities and casualties in outdoor locations by motive and location’, ‘FIRE0401: Deliberate fires by location and fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE0402: Fatalities and casualties in deliberate fires by location group and fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE0501: Fatalities and casualities from fires by nation’, ‘FIRE0502: Fatalities and casualties from fires by location, casualty type and fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE0901: Special service incidents attended by fire and rescue authority’, ‘FIRE0902: Special Service incidents attended by detailed type of action’ and ‘FIRE1401: Resident population estimates by nation and fire and rescue authority’.

description: The Home Office collects detailed information on incidents attended by Fire and Rescue Services.
